questions.question: What are the three core principles of the CIA triad in information security?

questions.question: What is the principle of least privilege?

questions.answer: An attempt to trick users into revealing sensitive information (like credentials or credit card numbers) by masquerading as a trustworthy entity in electronic communication.

questions.question: Can an EBS volume be attached to multiple EC2 instances simultaneously?

A type of EC2 instance family.

options: A serverless, event-driven compute service that lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers.

aws.title: AWS Networking

questions.question: What is Amazon VPC?
options: Virtual Private Cloud - A logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.
Virtual Public Cloud - A service for hosting public websites.
Virtual Private Connection - A type of VPN.
Virtual Protocol Controller - A network management tool.
questions.answer: Virtual Private Cloud - A logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.

questions.question: What is a subnet within an Amazon VPC?
options: A range of IP addresses within a VPC, residing entirely within one Availability Zone.
questions.answer: A range of IP addresses within a VPC, residing entirely within one Availability Zone.

questions.question: What component must be attached to a VPC to allow communication between instances in the VPC and the internet?

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a NAT Gateway or NAT Instance?
options: To enable instances in a private subnet to initiate outbound traffic to the internet or other AWS services, while preventing the internet from initiating connections with those instances.
To allow inbound internet traffic directly to instances in private subnets.
